sense.name: arrange and perform a play or show
sense.examples: The local drama group is staging a production of the musical 'Grease'. The actors guild will stage their latest drama in the local university auditorium.

sense.name: organize and execute an event
sense.examples: Barcelona staged the Olympic Games in 1992. I have staged an anti-drug campaign for the last 30 years. The riot was staged at the conclusion of two days of meetings at the University. The Hong Kong stock market staged a strong rally over the past week on expectations of improved local economic growth.

sense.name: fake an event
sense.examples: Authorities said Thursday they believe the disappearance was staged, so the serviceman could avoid returning to duty. Rosenthal has repeatedly and vociferously refuted claims that the flag raising was staged.
